Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by:  Rabbi Jonathan Glass, Civic Center Synagogue, 49 White Street, New York, NY  10007.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by COUNCIL MEMBER BREWER.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Rabbi Jonathan Glass, Civic Center Synagogue, 49 White Street, Nw York, New York 10013.

Council Member Brewer moved  that the invocation be spread in full upon the Minutes and adopted.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Messages and Papers from the Mayor

Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the name of Nicholas A. LaPorte, Jr. to the Council for its advice and consent regarding his appointment to the New York City Civil Service Commission, pursuant to Sections 31 and 813 of the New York City Charter.
Items.MatterName: Nicholas LaPorte, Jr., Civil Service Commission

Items.Title: Communications from City, County, and Borough Offices

Communication from the Brooklyn Borough President - Submitting the name of Dolly Williams to the Council for its advice and consent regarding her appointment as a member of the City Planning Commission, pursuant to Section 192 (a) of the New York City Charter.
Items.MatterName: Dolly Williams, City Planning Commission

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Transportation approving an enclosed sidewalk café located at 30-95 33rd Street, shall be subject to review by the Council. (Application no. 20025333 TCQ.)
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk Cafe, 30-95 33rd Street, Queens (20025333TCQ)

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to adopt Assembly Bill A.7906 and its companion, State Senate Bill S.5215, which would amend the public health law and the social services law, in relation to instituting a requirement for a criminal history report for nursing home, home care services agency and hospice employees.
Items.MatterName: Instituting a requirement for a criminal history report for nursing home care services agency and hospice employees.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to adopt Assembly Bill A.4601, which would amend the public health law and the executive law, in relation to requiring nursing homes and home care agencies to submit fingerprints of current and prospective employees for the purposes of a search of criminal history records of the division of criminal justice services and establishing a registry of home care services personnel.
Items.MatterName: Requiring nursing homes and home care agencies to submit fingerprints of current and prospective employees.

Items.Title: Reports of the Committee on Rules, Privileges, and Elections

Report of the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections approving the re-designation of WILLIAM FRANCIS KUNTZ II as a member of the New York City Civilian Complaint Review Board

The Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections which was referred to on September 25, 2002, respectfully

REPORTS

Pursuant to section 440 of the New York City Charter, the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections, hereby approves the re-designation by the Council of WILLIAM FRANCIS KUNTZ II, as a member of the New York City Civilian Complaint Review Board to serve for a the remainder of a three-year term expiring on July 4, 2005.

Res. No. 511

RESOLUTION APPROVING THE RE-DESIGNATION BY THE COUNCIL OF WILLIAM FRANCIS KUNTZ II AS A MEMBER OF THE  NEW YORK CITY CIVILIAN COMPLAINT REVIEW BOARD

By Council Member Comrie

RESOLVED, that pursuant to section 440 of the New York City Charter, the Council does hereby approve the re-designation of WILLIAM FRANCIS KUNTZ II, as a member of the New York City Civilian Complaint Review Board for a term expiring on July 4, 2005.
Items.MatterName: M 317 - William Francis Kuntz II, CCRB

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting the City from doing business with institutions that engage, directly or indirectly, in predatory lending practices, and to regulate the participation of home improvement contractors in the home-loan market.
Items.MatterName: Prohibit business with institutions that engage in predatory lending practices.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to authorizing an increase in the amount to be expended in nineteen business improvement districts.
Items.MatterName: Authorizing an increase in the amount to be expended in nineteen BIDs.

Items.Title:
Introduction of Local Laws and Resolutions
See Attached
General Discussion
Extension of Remarks
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

Resolution calling upon the Governor and the State Legislature to amend the New York State Navigation Law to require that all operators of mechanically propelled vessels be holders of a boating safety certificate and prohibit children under the age of fifteen from operating such vessels unless accompanied by a certificated person sixteen or older except for the operation of certain vessels with small engines.
Items.MatterName: Amend the New York State Navigation Law

Items.Title: Resolution recognizing October, 2002 as Breast Cancer Awareness Month in the City of New York.
Items.MatterName: Breast Cancer Awareness Month, October 2002

Items.Title: Resolution recognizing the 30th anniversary of Title IX and celebrating girls and women in sports.
Items.MatterName: Recognizing the 30th anniversary of Title IX.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to adopt the Younger Americans Act, which would provide assistance to mobilize and support United States communities in carrying out youth development programs that assure that all youth have access to programs and services that build competencies and character development.
Items.MatterName: Congress to adopt the Younger Americans Act.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to a park house name, John Malone Community Center, in McGuire Park, Borough of Brooklyn.
Items.MatterName: Name Change, John Malone Community Center, Brooklyn

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to providing on-demand ground vehicle transportation in areas underserved by taxicabs by establishing stands where licensed for-hire vehicles may accept passengers without prearrangement.
Items.MatterName: Providing on-demand ground vehicle transportation in areas underserved by taxicabs.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Governor of the State of New York to direct the Metropolitan Transportation Authority-New York City Transit (MTA-NYCT) to disclose and make available to the public and other government entities financial documents and analyses that might indicate whether a fare increase is necessary or justified.
Items.MatterName: (MTA-NYCT) to disclose and make available documents & analyses that might indicate whether a fare increase is necessary or justified.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the use of roadway space in front of buildings.
Items.MatterName: Use of roadway space in front of buildings.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to police interrogations.
Items.MatterName: Police Interrogations

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the provision of equal employment benefits to the employees of city contractors.
Items.MatterName: Equal employment benefits to the employees of city contractors.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon Congress to pass legislation repealing the provisions of federal law that discourage states from providing in-state tuition rates to undocumented immigrants and permitting long-time resident youth with good moral character who move on to higher education to obtain permanent resident status.
Items.MatterName: Senate to pass the DREAM Act (S.1291) and U.S. House of Representatives to pass the Student Adjustment Act (H.R. 1918)

This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if called-up by vote of the Council pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and §20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code.

Items.Title: Roll Call
Discussion of Resolutions

Resolution supporting Reverend David Benke, President of the Atlantic District, Lutheran Church Missouri Synod and Pastor of St. Peter's Lutheran Church in Brooklyn, who was recently suspended from his denomination's clergy roster for participating in the patriotic civic event at Yankee Stadium on September 23, 2001.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.MinutesNote: Adopted by Council by unanimous voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Supporting Reverend David Benke

Items.Title: Resolution, on the 60th anniversary of the fall of Bataan, urging President George W. Bush and the United States Congress to support U.S. House of Representatives bill HR-491 and U.S. Senate bill S-1042.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.MinutesNote: Adopted by Council by unanimous voice vote.
Items.MatterName: The 60th anniversary of the fall of Bataan.

Items.Title: Resolution admonishing the Board of Regents of the University of the State of New York (the "Board of Regents") for "breaking tradition" by failing to elect to the position of Chancellor the incumbent Vice Chancellor, as has been the tradition of the Board of Regents, and requesting that the Board of Regents explain to the New York State Legislature, all statewide educational organizations, and to all New Yorkers why they neglected to follow this tradition and to seize the opportunity presented to them to elevate to the position of Chancellor, incumbent Vice Chancellor Sanford, a visionary and committed educational leader who has worked tirelessly on behalf of all the children of the State of New York to provide them with a quality education through the state's public school system.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Higher Education
Items.MinutesNote: Adopted by Council by unanimous voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Admonishing the Board of Regents, University of the State of New York  for "breaking tradition" regarding Vice Chancellor Sanford.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Navy to vacate its training facility on the Puerto Rican island of Vieques and to cease and desist from violating the civil rights of the Puerto Rican people to peaceful assembly on the Island Vieques.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.MinutesNote: Adopted by Council by unanimous voice vote.
Items.MatterName: U.S. Navy to vacate its training facility on the Puerto Rican Island, Vieques
